SENT.plain: The authors present a new, unusual side effect due to retained pacemaker lead
The free tip of the lead caused cerebral embolism by perforating the interatrial septum
Transoesophageal echocardiographic study showed the lead crossing the interatrial septum
The total abnormal course of the lead was demonstrated by lateral X-ray picture
Diagnostic and therapeutic approaches regarding retained leads in malposition are also discussed
